text: Trying to teach mea lesson in patience, Sir Joseph?
title: The Mummy

text: Method is everything in archaeology.
title: The Mummy

text: We always deal withour finds of the day in order.

text: than from all the sensational finds.

title: The Mummy

text: not to satisfy our own curiosity.
title: The Mummy

text: Oh, that's all very true, Sir Joseph,but, after all, we're human.

text: "Imhotep".

text: We recognise your masteryof the occult sciences, Muller.

text: Oh, I cannot speak before a boy.

text: Come out under the stars of Egypt.

text: Do not touch that casket.

text: Go on with your cataloguing.We'll open it later.

text: Don't think you canpersuade me not to examine

text: the most wonderful findof my whole experience out here.
title: The Mummy

text: If you are right about the legend, then thiscasket may contain the Scroll of Thoth,
title: The Mummy

text: from the holy of holies in the temple, andI can hardly wait to get back to find out.

text: The gods of Egypt still live in these hills,in their ruined temples.
title: The Mummy

text: The ancient spells are weaker,but some of them are still potent.
title: The Mummy

text: And I believe that you havein your hut the Scroll of Thoth itself,

text: which contains the great spell with whichIsis raised Osiris from the dead.

text: In the interests of science,even if I believed in the curse,

text: I'd go on with my work for the museum.

text: Well, Whemple, back we go to London.

title: The Mummy

text: He went crazy. Bored beyond humanendurance in this sand and these rocks.

text: Your father never explained.

text: Your expedition has not been a success.

text: since that of Tutankhamen.

text: - Daughter of Amenophis the Magnificent.- Yes. It's her name.

text: Anyhow, we've found something.

title: The Mummy

text: No. I'm not going out.
title: The Mummy

text: Yes. I promise to wait until you get here.

text: Goodbye. And I'm so dreadfully sorry.

text: What were you doing, Doctor?
title: The Mummy

text: Your father did not burnthe Scroll of Thoth.
title: The Mummy

text: That creature has it now.
title: The Mummy

text: - The ashes in the fireplace!- They were newspaper.

text: The scroll is papyrus.

text: Then it was murder? The Nubian!
title: The Mummy

text: Wear this around your neck.
title: The Mummy

title: The Mummy

title: The Mummy

text: - I'll give it to Helen. She needs protection.- No, her life is not in danger.
title: The Mummy

text: It is her soul.
title: The Mummy

text: Should love for you come to her,he will try to destroy you.
title: The Mummy

text: That amulet, the Egyptians believed,was a charm against evil sendings,
title: The Mummy

text: such as struck down your father.
title: The Mummy

text: Your dog is frightened.
title: The Mummy

text: My servant will see to him.
title: The Mummy

text: Sit down, Miss Grosvenor.
title: The Mummy

text: Ancient Egypt.
title: The Mummy

text: Nothing modern.
title: The Mummy

text: What a strange incense.
title: The Mummy

text: Is it not familiar to you?
title: The Mummy

text: - No.- Our forefathers used it.
title: The Mummy

text: Yours and mine.
title: The Mummy

text: You will not rememberwhat I show you now,
title: The Mummy

text: and yet I shall awaken memoriesof love and crime and death.
title: The Mummy

text: I knelt by the bed of death.
title: The Mummy

text: Thy father's last farewell.
title: The Mummy

text: I knew the Scroll of Thothcould bring thee back to life.
title: The Mummy

text: I dared the god's anger, and stole it.
title: The Mummy

text: I stole back to thy tombto bring thee back to life.
title: The Mummy

text: I murmured the spell that raises the dead.
title: The Mummy

text: They broke in upon meand found me doing an unholy thing.
title: The Mummy

text: Thy father condemned meto the nameless death.
title: The Mummy

text: The scroll he ordered buried with me,
title: The Mummy

text: that no such sacrilegemight disgrace Egypt again.
title: The Mummy

text: A nameless grave. The slaves were killedso that none should know.
title: The Mummy

text: The soldiers who killed themwere also slain,
title: The Mummy

text: so no friend could creep to the desert
title: The Mummy

text: with funeral offeringsfor my condemned spirit.
title: The Mummy

text: Anck-es-en-Amon.
title: The Mummy

text: My love has lasted longerthan the temples of our gods.
title: The Mummy

text: No man ever suffered as I did for you.
title: The Mummy

text: The rest you may not know.
title: The Mummy

text: Not until you are about to pass throughthe great night of terror and triumph,
title: The Mummy

text: until you are ready to face momentsof horror for an eternity of love,
title: The Mummy

text: until I send backyour spirit, that has wandered
title: The Mummy

text: through so many formsand so many ages.
title: The Mummy

text: But, before then,Bast must again send forth death.
title: The Mummy

text: Death to that boy for whomlove is creeping into your heart.
title: The Mummy

text: Love that would keep you from myself.
title: The Mummy

text: Love that might bringsickness and even death to you.
title: The Mummy

text: Awake.
title: The Mummy

text: Have I been asleep?
title: The Mummy

text: I had strange dreams.
title: The Mummy

text: Dreams of ancient Egypt, I think.There was someone like you in them.
title: The Mummy

text: My pool is sometimes troubled.
title: The Mummy

text: One sees strange fantasies in the water.But they pass like dreams.
title: The Mummy

text: My dog! Wolfram! Wolfram!
title: The Mummy

text: Where is he?
title: The Mummy

text: Helen.
title: The Mummy

text: Helen! Where have you been?
title: The Mummy

text: We've been so worried.We've hunted everywhere.
title: The Mummy

text: - In the museum again?- Yes.
title: The Mummy

text: Muller's down in the Arab quarter now.
title: The Mummy

text: Well, if I must give an explanation,it was stuffy in here.
title: The Mummy

text: I can't be shut up all the time. And I don'tlike the feeling I'm always being watched.
title: The Mummy

text: - I took the dog with me.- Where is the dog?
title: The Mummy

text: He's dead.
title: The Mummy

text: - But how?- I don't know.
title: The Mummy

text: - Well, where?- I don't remember.
title: The Mummy

text: But I can see it now.
title: The Mummy

text: Standing on poor Wolfram's back.
title: The Mummy

text: - A white cat.- A white cat?
title: The Mummy

text: The cat-goddess Bast!
title: The Mummy

text: Yes, there was a statue of Bast.
title: The Mummy

text: The goddess of evil sendings!
title: The Mummy

text: Just what happened?Try to remember, Helen!
title: The Mummy

text: I don't want to remember. Besides,I don't see it's any affair of yours.
title: The Mummy

text: Oh, but it is.
title: The Mummy

text: We know that you were with Ardath Bey.
title: The Mummy

text: Oh, Helen. Helen, I love you.
title: The Mummy

text: I'm trying to help youand protect you. We all are.
title: The Mummy

text: Don't let me go again.I'll try to get away, but you mustn't let me.
title: The Mummy

text: No matter what I do or what I say.
title: The Mummy

text: There's death there for me.
title: The Mummy

text: And life for something elseinside me that isn't me.
title: The Mummy

text: But it's alive too, and fighting for life.
title: The Mummy

text: Save me from it, Frank. Save me.
title: The Mummy

text: Oh, everything's going to be all right.
title: The Mummy

text: Now that you've asked for help,I'll never leave you alone.
title: The Mummy

text: I'll get Mrs Muller down here with you,and I'll stay here till the doctor comes.
title: The Mummy

text: Then, we'll take you to my house.
title: The Mummy

text: Oh, Helen. It's been such torture.
title: The Mummy

text: I love you so.
title: The Mummy

text: I don't like that doctor. Please go in thereand find out what he's saying about me.
title: The Mummy

text: I will, my dear. He'll know justwhat's the matter with you and cure you.
title: The Mummy

text: Now, don't worry.
title: The Mummy

text: Now, Miss Farthing, help meto get dressed and get out of here.
title: The Mummy

text: - Come over you again, Miss Grosvenor?- I must escape. I'm being held. Help me.
title: The Mummy

text: You told me, whenthese fits came on I wasn't to listen.
title: The Mummy

text: I have a friend. He's rich.He'll give you money.
title: The Mummy

text: Now you just lie down again.You know you mustn't get up.
title: The Mummy

text: If you don't want money,what do you want most?
title: The Mummy

text: He'll give you anything,if only you'll help me to go to him.
title: The Mummy

text: Do you want me to call Dr Muller?
title: The Mummy

text: - No. I hate him.- Mr Whemple, then?
title: The Mummy

text: I'll die if I don't get away from him!
title: The Mummy

text: - Now, Miss Grosvenor.- It's killing me!
title: The Mummy

text: Now, Helen, you must not do this again.
title: The Mummy

text: You're always so exhausted afterwards.
title: The Mummy

text: She's too weak to be removedexcept to a hospital.
title: The Mummy

text: I insist on keeping her hereunder our direct observation.
title: The Mummy

text: But, Doctor, you haven't told us whatto do. She gets weaker every day.
title: The Mummy

text: You know that neglig�e I bought in Paris?Help me to put it on.
title: The Mummy

text: And bring me my toilet things.I want some colour. I want to look well.
title: The Mummy

text: You can't, my dear. They'd never allow it.
title: The Mummy

text: - The nurse would be sure...- I know. We'll get rid of her.
title: The Mummy

text: This is a plot, just between us.I want to look the way I did.
title: The Mummy

text: Just a surprise, for Frank.
title: The Mummy

text: And I want you to bring him to me.You understand?
title: The Mummy

text: In short, I have failed to make a diagnosis.
title: The Mummy

text: Medical science is helplessin a case like this.
title: The Mummy

text: Frank.
title: The Mummy

text: Go to her, and don't be angry with me.I couldn't resist her.
title: The Mummy

text: Helen, you shouldn't have done this.They shouldn't have let you.
title: The Mummy

text: Just this once. Perhaps the last time.
title: The Mummy

text: But you're going to get well.Then I know I can make you love me.
title: The Mummy

text: I know I can make you happy.
title: The Mummy

text: I do love you, Frank.And I'm trying to prove it,
title: The Mummy

text: because I'd rather diethan live and lose you.
title: The Mummy

text: But you're going to live.We're not going to lose each other.
title: The Mummy

text: - So, my dear. You...- Don't scold me.
title: The Mummy

text: Just feminine vanity.I wanted to look my best again.
title: The Mummy

text: So you know morethan I realised you knew.
title: The Mummy

text: - What do you mean?- These impulses to go to him.
title: The Mummy

text: The pull is too strongto withstand and live.
title: The Mummy

text: I am so glad you understand.

text: Helen knows. She knowsthe moment she stops struggling,
title: The Mummy

text: he will give her backher strength to come to him.
title: The Mummy

text: But I don't want to lose my own mindand be someone else. Someone I hate.

text: My dear, while you were growing worse,we tried to find him and failed.

text: The next time the call comes, go to him.

text: Muller, what can we do now?
title: The Mummy

text: We can do no more.Ardath has beaten me.

text: The next time he draws her to him,we must follow her.

text: I've given her some bromide.She's asleep now. I'll go to bed.

text: Good night.
title: The Mummy

text: Where are we?
title: The Mummy

text: This is my bed, but this is not the temple,nor my father's palace.
title: The Mummy

text: Do not look, Anck-es-en-Amon.
title: The Mummy

text: Do not be afraid.
title: The Mummy

text: I was afraid. When you knelt beside mybed, a veil came over my eyes. Darkness.
title: The Mummy

text: Your last memory is of mein the hour of your death
title: The Mummy

text: as I knelt by your bed, 3700 years ago.
title: The Mummy

text: No man has ever sufferedfor woman as you suffered for me.
title: The Mummy

text: - Now that the gods have forgiven us...- No, no, not yet.
title: The Mummy

text: Your soul is in a mortal body,
title: The Mummy

text: renewed many timessince we loved in Thebes of old.
title: The Mummy

text: But that love is not for us againuntil the great change.
title: The Mummy

text: I do not understand.
title: The Mummy

text: Look.
title: The Mummy

text: - Look and wonder.- A figure of myself.
title: The Mummy

text: It is my coffin,made by my father against my death.
title: The Mummy

text: What mummy has usurpedmy eternal resting place?
title: The Mummy

text: It is thy dead shell.I tried then to raise this body.
title: The Mummy

text: I could raise it now, but it would bea mere thing that moved at my will,
title: The Mummy

text: without a soul.
title: The Mummy

text: It was not only this bodythat I loved, it was thy soul.
title: The Mummy

text: I destroy this lifeless thing.
title: The Mummy

text: Thou shalt take its placebut for a few moments,
title: The Mummy

text: and then rise again,even as I have risen.
title: The Mummy

text: Come.
title: The Mummy

text: Imhotep, this is the place of embalming.
title: The Mummy

text: It is not lawful for me, a priestess of Isis,to see or touch an unclean thing.
title: The Mummy

text: Come to the altar of Anubis,the guide of the dead.
title: The Mummy

text: The time has come for the final prayer.
title: The Mummy

text: What have I to do with Anubis?
title: The Mummy

text: The ancient ritesmust be performed over thy body.
title: The Mummy

text: Then I will readthe great spell with which
title: The Mummy

text: Isis brought Osiris back from the grave.
title: The Mummy

text: And thou shalt rise again.
title: The Mummy

text: No.
title: The Mummy

text: No, I'm alive! I'm young!
title: The Mummy

text: I won't die!
title: The Mummy

text: I loved you once,but now you belong with the dead.
title: The Mummy

text: I am Anck-es-en-Amon, but I...
title: The Mummy

text: I'm somebody else too.
title: The Mummy

text: I want to live,even in a strange new world.
title: The Mummy

text: For thy sake I was buried alive.
title: The Mummy

text: I ask of thee only a moment of agony.Only so can we be united.

text: The bath of natron.
title: The Mummy

text: You shall not plunge my body into that.

text: Let the deed be done.
title: The Mummy

text: Let me go. Let me go!
title: The Mummy

text: Don't kill me! I'm a priestess of Isis.

text: Save me from that mummy! It's dead!
title: The Mummy

text: Save me!
title: The Mummy

text: I no longer fear you.Do with me what you will.

text: Frank.
title: The Mummy

text: Frank!
title: The Mummy

text: She has gone to him.They must be in the museum.
title: The Mummy

text: Now I know his horrible plan.
title: The Mummy

text: He is going to kill her, andmake her a living mummy like himself.
title: The Mummy

text: The gods will receive into the underworldthe spirit of Anck-es-en-Amon.
title: The Mummy

text: But not for long.
title: The Mummy

text: Osiris will release thy soul.
title: The Mummy

text: You shall rest from life,like the setting sun in the west.

text: But you shall dawn anew in the east,
title: The Mummy

text: as the first rays of Amon-Radispel the shadow.

text: Helen! Helen!
title: The Mummy

text: Helen.
title: The Mummy

text: O Isis, holy maiden.I was thy consecrated vestal.

text: I broke my vows. Save me now!
title: The Mummy

text: Teach me the ancient summons,the holy spells I've forgotten.
title: The Mummy

text: I call upon thee as of old!
title: The Mummy

text: Helen!
title: The Mummy

text: Call her. He has dragged herback to ancient Egypt.
title: The Mummy
